metro.GameScreen

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • metro.GameScreen.GameScreen
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CityView, LineSelectTool, LineView, MainMenu, MainView, NotificationArea, PlayingField, StationPlacingTool, Toolbar, TrackPlacingTool, TrainView, TrainViewBuy, TrainViewMain

    public abstract class GameScreen
extends java.util.Observable
    Every Menu or Game Sreen has to implement this interface for start() and update(). This will make the creation process more easy.
    Author:
    Hauke

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GameScreen.InGameMenuWindow
      This is the menu that'll appear after pressing ESC during the game.
      class  GameScreen.SettingsWindow
      This is the settings window, that provides some options to configure.

    • Field Detail

      • _settingsWindow

        public GameScreen.SettingsWindow _settingsWindow
        Makes it possible to create a settings-window from every(!) game screen.

        Makes it possible to create a ingame-menu-window from every(!) game screen.

      • __controlActionManager

        private static ControlActionManager __controlActionManager

      • _allControls

        private java.util.ArrayList<ControlElement> _allControls
        A list of all control. Seems senseless due to the list in the ActionControlManager, but this is a list with control that only belongs to this game screen.

    • Method Detail

      • setActionManager

        public static void setActionManager(ControlActionManager manager)
        Sets the new control action manager.
        Parameters:
        manager - An instance of the ControlActionManager.

      • updateGameScreen

        public abstract void updateGameScreen(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch sp)
        Updates the actual game screen.
        Parameters:
        sp - SpriteBatch to draw on.

      • mouseClicked

        public abstract void mouseClicked(int screenX,
                int screenY,
                int mouseButton)
        When mouse has clicked
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x-position on the screen
        screenY - The y-position on the screen
        mouseButton - The number of the button like Buttons.LEFT

      • mouseReleased

        public abstract void mouseReleased(int mouseButton)
        When mouse has been released.
        Parameters:
        mouseButton - The number of the button like Buttons.LEFT

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(int keyCode)
        When a key was pressed.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Key number from Gdx.Input

      • keyUp

        public void keyUp(int keyCode)
        Forwards the key up event to the active input control.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Key number from Gdx.Input

      • keyDown

        public abstract void keyDown(int keyCode)
        When a key was pressed AND it has been checked weather the ESC key for the ingame menu window has been pressed.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Key number from Gdx.Input

      • mouseScrolled

        public abstract void mouseScrolled(int amount)
        Fires when user scrolls.
        Parameters:
        amount - Positive or negative amount of steps since last frame.

      • createMenuWindow

        public void createMenuWindow()
        Creates the in-game menu window with the yes/no option for exiting the game but provides a settings button as well.

      • createSettingsWindow

        public void createSettingsWindow()
        Create a settings menu with some options to configure METRO.

      • setSelectedInput

        public void setSelectedInput(InputField field)
        Sets the selected field to a new one. Reset selected field with null as parameter. The Input-component will be informed about the change.
        Parameters:
        field - The selected input component.

      • getSelectedInput

        public InputField getSelectedInput()
        Gets the current/selected input field. Can be null -> no input selected.
        Returns:
        Selected input field.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • isActive

        public abstract boolean isActive()
        When a game screen is active it can be used, otherwise it'll be deleted, ignored, ...
        Returns:
        True when active and usable, false when inactive, closed, ...

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the game screen to its default values.

      • isHovered

        public abstract boolean isHovered()
        Returns:
        True when mouse is in sensible/important area of the game screen.

      • registerControl

        public void registerControl(ControlElement control)
        Registers a control in the control manager.
        Parameters:
        control - The control to add.

      • unregisterControl

        public void unregisterControl(ControlElement control)
        Unregistered an control element from the control manager to disable user interactions with it. Use this method from a game screen and NOT the METRO.__unregisterControl(ControlElement) method!
        Parameters:
        control - The control to remove.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the game screen by removing all controls from the game screen. Normally this method is called via METRO.closeGameScreen(GameScreen) to use the correct control manager.
